overview_of_class: COURSE DESCRIPTION: Composers, performers, and musical institutions in Hitler's Germany and Stalin's Russia underwent profound and even traumatic transformations. In this course we will examine the effects of these changes on musical life from the 1920s through the aftermath of World War II. Special topics to be covered include the crackdown by the Soviet government on Sergei Prokofiev and Dmitri Shostakovich in 1936 and again in 1948, the Munich exhibit of "Entartete Musik" (Degenerate Music) in 1938, music in concentration camps, the concept of Internal Exile ("Innere Imigration"), and the controversial careers of figures such as Richard Strauss, Wilhelm Furtwängler, Herbert von Karajan, and Elizabeth Schwarzkopf.
name: Topics in 20th Century Music
subject: MUSICOL
